CLUE: Win a trick by using a trump
OUTPUT: ["Observe which suit has been led so far during the play round; this is important to determine if you have any cards that match it and can beat your opponent's lead.", 'Play your lowest card of the led suit unless you possess high-value cards in other suits, especially trump cards.', 'If no cards are matching the led suit or none can win the trick (because they cannot outrank the highest card already played), play a low trump card if available to save higher ones for later use.', 'Remember that sometimes it is strategic not to win every trick, especially in games like Hearts where you want to avoid capturing certain cards or points.', 'If leading yourself and intending to take the trick with a trump card, lead low from another suit unless you can safely lead a singleton (a single card) of your strongest non-trump suit without giving up control of that suit', 'Keep track of the cards played during earlier rounds and use this information to anticipate which cards your opponents might still have in their hands']
